Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Venous Thromboembolism After Lung Transplantation

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients undergoing LT, with eligibility criteria including age over 18 and absence of pre-existing VTE.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received standard VTE prophylaxis, while the control group received extended prophylaxis.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the incidence, clinical features, and outcomes of VTE after LT.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of VTE within 90 days post-LT.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention group and 100 to the control group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention group and 100 to the control group

Result_Outcome.evidence: In the intervention group, 15% developed VTE compared to 25% in the control group (risk difference = -10%, 95% CI -18% to -2%; p = 0.02).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 5% of the intervention group and 8% of the control group, with no severe events.

Funding.evidence: This study was funded by the National Institutes of Health.
